head.supplied: Melbourne botanic Garden, ¶ 14 June 1862 ¶ sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to authorize the expenditure of seventy pounds £70 Sterling for purchases of plants in this es...

div.p: V62/3799, unit 749, VPRS 1189/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to authorize the expenditure of seventy pounds £70 Sterling for purchases of plants in this establishment, this being the sum left available for the purpose from the vote of 1862. As several importations of plants have recently arrived and others are expected and required at this time of the year, I have taken the liberty to solicit at once for the authority of the total remaining amount.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: your most obedient and humble Ferd. Mueller.

& & &
Approval for M's request was annotated to this letter.
